channel.title: Memo on Wood 'n Fab
channel.description: Recent content in Memo on Wood 'n Fab

item.title: Rootanika
item.description:
Rootanika

Rootanika is a fusion project between the open-source CNC machines of Root CNC and Mekanika CNC. The goal is to combine the best of both worlds into a modular, accessible, and powerful CNC machine for makers, hobbyists, and small workshops.

Project Goals

  • Combine the rigidity and strength of Root CNC with the user-friendly design and clean aesthetics of Mekanika CNC.
  • Design a fully customizable, belt-driven machine with a focus on reusable and accessible components.
  • Keep the target cost around ‚Ç¨800 (excluding spindle and spoilboard), making it affordable without compromising performance.
  • Document everything open-source following the principles of both original projects.

Licensing

Rootanika follows the Creative Commons BY-NC-SA 4.0 license, same as its sources. This means:

item.title: Air Compressor
item.description:
I don’t own an air compressor yet, but I consider it an essential tool for any workshop.
Below is a short overview of useful information, tests, and models I‚Äôve found so far.

üé• YouTube - Quietest & Fastest Compressor Ever Tested!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a3hMRQZudiE

This video gives an overview of small compressors and shows how difficult it can be to select the right one.

Top three models mentioned:

  • DeWalt
  • Husky
  • Fornax

üëâ What I find strange: the DeWalt compressor doesn‚Äôt seem to have an intake air filter (or at least, I couldn‚Äôt find it in the manual).

item.title: Compound Slide Table
item.description:
I once bought a cheap compound slide table via marktplaats.nl (a large second-hand website in the Netherlands).
This particular one was branded HBM, which is a well-known tool supplier in the Netherlands.

üîß I originally wanted to use it with a column drill, or even something like a Dremel, for more precise drilling.

‚ö†Ô∏è However, it felt too flimsy, so I started looking for sturdier versions. Luckily, there are several models available, with prices ranging from ‚Ç¨30 to about ‚Ç¨100.

item.title: My ROOT CNC
item.description:
I recently bought a used ROOT CNC machine on the local marketplace.
It needs some repairs ‚Äî a few parts are broken ‚Äî and it looks like the previous owner made some modifications.

This memo is a place to collect reference links and notes related to this machine.

üß© 3D Printed Parts

üìå Z-Carriage System for ROOT 3 CNC (or similar machines)

Thingiverse ‚Äì Carriage Z System for 52mm & 65mm Spindle (in progress)
